Running a scheduled calculation
The System allows you to configure
Running a scheduled calculation
.
Initially, you need to set the
Object autorun parameters
as an instance of the object type
Calculation autorun parameters
.
where:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the name of the parameter to start the calculation automatically.
Methodology
Selecting a methodology from the drop-down list.
Reporting date algorithm (optional)
Selecting an algorithm from the drop-down list (the field may remain empty).
Object selection
Specifying the object selection mode to apply the calculation. Possible values:
Select by type (with filtering algorithm)
Select by object type
Select manually from the list; the calculation objects must be specified in the table.
Dynamics type
Selecting calculation dynamics type from the drop-down list.
Object type to calculate
Selecting a methodology from the drop-down list. The calculation is based on the object type
Calculation Module. Calculation profile
and its child items. It is specified when choosing the
Select by type
mode.
Object filtering algorithm to calculate
Selecting a filtering algorithm from the drop-down list. It is specified when choosing
Select by type (with filtering algorithm)
.
Calculation objects are entered in the table using the
button above the
Calculation Objects
table when choosing the
Select manually from the list
item.
To save the calculation run parameter, click
in the type profile.
Next, if needed, specify a certain start time (for more information, refer to
CRON Scheduler
).
To set a schedule to run a calculation, you need to:
1. Create a new
Action Scheduler
(for more information, refer to
Running scheduled actions
)
2. In the
Name
field, specify the
Schedule name
.
3. In the
Action Operation Scheduler
field, specify the start time of the algorithm (for more information, refer to
CRON Scheduler
).
4. In the
System action
field, select
Run calculation
.
5. In the
Object with action parameters
field, specify the parameters to run the calculation automatically (the parameters are set as an instance of the object type; described in more detail below).
6. In the
Schedule valid
field, choose
Yes
.
7. Click
to save the schedule to run the algorithm.
The following fields will be filled in automatically:
Last run was successful
: it displays the result of the running algorithm; possible values:
Yes: completed successfully
No: run failed
Last run date
: it displays the date and time of the last run.
You have completed a schedule for automatic running of a calculation.
